page.title: 06DEEPING ST.JAMES SIGNAL BOX
page.content: The signal box is situated about one and a half miles out of the village where the B1166 crosses the line.There is no longer a station.It was closed down because it was not used much.The station masters house is now a private dwelling. About 40 trains go past each day. A few are local passenger trains running between Spalding and Peterborough. The rest are freight trains coming from Peterborough, Lincoln, Boston,and as far north as Doncaster.The nearest main line is the London and North Eastern railway. When a bell rings the crossing keeper has 5 minutes in which to close the gates and change all the signals to green.Inside the signal box it is fairly small. There are big levers which operate the signals and points.
